metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10022 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Xpdf 4.01.01. There is a NULL pointer dereference in the function Gfx::opSetExtGState in Gfx.cc.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10022` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
libpoppler-cpp0v5 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
libpoppler118 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
poppler-utils - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> xpdf in koffice is 2.0 mdeslaur> couldn't reproduce in poppler ebarretto> xpdf in Debian uses poppler, which is not affected or fixed

criterions.comment: poppler package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.76.1-0ubuntu3').
